description:
You still have to manually go to the website, and add their PPA.
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:bit-team/stable
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install backintime-qt4
summary: Does Not Actually Install The Backintime Program

description: You have to have permission to backup the home folder apparently so this app is useless. The root one may work but I am just gonna use terminal rsync, that is what this app is using.

I've used Back In Time for several years for backing up my Home folder. I've never tried the root version. Things I like:
1. User interface: Easy to set up folders to be included or excluded.
2. Can set up multiple backup profiles with different schedules and backup file locations.
3. Auto-remove feature. Which allows allows for maintaining a minimum amount of free drive space.
4. Although I've always run restore jobs using the interface, the backup files are stored uncompressed, so if need be, you can find a file by directly searching your backup location.
5. The user interface allows renaming snapshots (backups), and those can be protected from deletion.
6. It's easy to restore from an earlier Snapshot (backup) in case you need to recover an earlier version of a document.
summary: Versatile with easy setup and configuration

description: It may need some improvements, but it gets the job done.
Backs up files individually, not in one compressed archive. This is handy when you want to browse a backup and restore an individual file.
summary: Over the years, I have found it reliable and easy to use

description: Inkrementelle Klartextsicherung. Auch die Wiederherstellung funktioniert super.
Unauffällig und solide. Verwende es schon seit Jahren .
